Name: The Bicycle Race
Description:
An early British roll and move board game with a Bicycle theme.  Players start in one corner of the board and move along a spiral track to their destination at the centre of the board.

There are a number of hazards along the way such as "Tyre Punctured" and "Dog Run Down"!

Name: Deluxe Poker Rummy Game
Description:
In Deluxe Poker Rummy there are two sets of 4 different color tiles (black, red, yellow and blue) each numbering 2 through 10 plus Jack, Queen, King, and Ace; plus 2 jokers. The games comes with rules to play both the American Way and the International Way.

How to play Deluxe Poker Rummy the American Way:

Each players picks 14 tiles and must have a total of 25 points in one or more sets or runs in their hand in order to place those tiles on the table. After you place your initial tiles down you are ready to play the table (i.e. add to sets or runs already played) but if during your turn you are unable to play on the table you must pick a tile from the remaining ones. Jokers are wild.
     
     The first player who gets rid of all the tiles in his hand is the winner.  The other remaining players must total all the points left in their hand.  Each tile is worth the number of points as valued on the tile.  The jokers are worth 25 points.
     Your objective therefore is to keep as few points in your hand as possible.

How to play Deluxe Poker Rummy the American Way:

The bricks are laid face down, shuffled and arranged - still face down - in one stack of 8 bricks and fourteen stacks of 7 bricks each, starting from left to right. The opener starts the game by turning face up the top brick of the last stack on the left which then becomes "Trump" for the round.

The stacks are then dealt until each player has 14 bricks, except for Player #2, which will have 15. Player #2 takes an unwanted one from his hand and puts it on the table to his right, face up.

The first stage of the game is to arrange the bricks on your stand in Sets of "Runs" or "Groups". Players draw a brick from the pool and then discard either it or another brick from their stand. You can meld any Sets from your stand onto the table, provided their total value is 50 or more. Once a Set has been melded it may be added to, but not changed or taken back.

—user summary

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – The "C" Team Pack
Description: The “C” Team Pack contains four illustrious Acquisitions Incorporated characters that can be used immediately in your existing Clank! game, or even join your Clank! Legacy Acquisitions Incorporated franchise!

Name: Dziewięć światów
Description: A cooperative quiz game which helps teach children about the Nordic mythology. Players have to work together, travelling through the titular Nine Worlds, and answering the questions correctly in order to put the terrifying wyrm Nidhögg back to sleep, before the monster topples the World Tree Yggdrasil and everyone loses.

Name: Defender of the Order
Description:
You wanted a peaceful life . . . taking care of others, meditation and dedication to your Order . . . yeah, right? Questing is where it is at! Do you have what it takes? Can you become a Saint of the Order before a horde of Demon banish you into the Pit of Despair? All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing Orders, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Will you be recognized by your Order . . . your deity? Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page.  You roll. You write.  Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask.  This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) into the Fantasy Realm.

—description from the designer

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Maximum Extermination!
Description: This expansion adds the Supreme Dalek, Special Weapons Dalek, and the Genesis Ark to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, six Dalek faction cards, and five new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Autons
Description: This expansion adds Autons to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, three Auton faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – The Children of Heaven
Description:
As political upheaval disrupts the balance in Rokugan, Courtiers are needed more than ever to stand for their clan in court. While blades on the battlefield can turn the tide of the conflict, it is the courtiers and politicians of Rokugan who can use their power to enact massive changes in the Emerald Empire, and those who have the Emperor’s ear can shift the entire balance of Rokugan.

Experience the courts of the Emerald Empire with The Children of Heaven, the fourth of Dynasty Pack of the Inheritance cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

The Children of Heaven continues the themes of the Inheritance cycle by focusing on the Courtiers of Rokugan, able to dominate political conflicts with ease.  Also look for a new Crab province that becomes stronger the more times it is attacked, a new Phoenix event that allows you to overwhelm your opponent with Spells, and a Scorpion event that can dishonor multiple characters at once.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Quibbles
Description:
The Game of Very Cross Words

Quibbles is a fun and fast-moving word building family game.

In this exciting new word game, players work independently to create inter-locking words in crossword fashion and can re-arrange the position of their letter tiles as often and as much as they need to complete their words.

Object of the Game
To gain the highest score at the end of the game.

Game Play Summary
Players each select 20 tiles and try to use them all in a complete crossword. When the tiles are all used that player shouts "GRAB" and all players must pick up an extra tile. 
Bad Boy Tiles are Wild and can be used as any letter.

When a Bad Boy Tile is picked up a Bad Boy Card must also be selected from the pile.

BEWARE: Bad Boy Cards may contain GOOD or BAD NEWS and instructions must be followed.

Play continues until all the tiles have been used and the first player to finish shouts "I'VE QUIBBLED!".

Scores are then calculated to ascertain the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNO: Pokemon Sun & Moon
Description:
Collectible UNO card game with designs from the video game Pokemon Sun & Moon. The global rule is same that UNO, but is a Japanese version. 
UNO appeared with a lot of Pokemon including Pikachu, Mokuro, Ashimari, Nyaby and so on.Four original special rule [1000 Mangold] cards also entered, and it was more fun and finished in a special 
UNO.

—user summary
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Göteborg (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description: Localized expansion featuring the tram lines of Göteborg. Crowd-funded licensed printings in 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2022

Name: Geocaching: The Game
Description:
Players move around the Geocaching trail to try to get the most trinkets from caches. The board has a main track and side tracks that can be used to help you toward your goal. Play is counter-clockwise and you must roll a die to move. Certain spaces, characters on the board, and GPS cards that you gain can send you elsewhere on the board, or even physically at the table. Others reward, help or hold you back. Once you get past the Finish (which you can only do if you aren't bringing Travel Bugs with you), you stay in the game, trying to protect your stash, until everyone else catches up. The person with the most Trinkets wins!

—description from the designer

Name: JW Studio Maker
Description:
JW Studio Maker is a fast-paced tabletop experience! Each player takes on the role of a Movie Producer working for the world-renowned Billionaire JW and his newly formed movie studio. Collectively players will have access to over $100 million to gather talent in the form of Directors, Casts, and Writers. The winner is determined by the amount of money each player’s movies have earned by the end of the game.

JW Studio Maker is played over several rounds, each round representing one week of movie production. As the Producer, players assemble movies by choosing from the best available talent and combining their star power to generate revenue at the box office. Participate in intense bidding wars, win awards, deal with disgruntled employees, and most of all make movies!

—description from the designer

Name: Quantum Shock
Description:
Quantum Shock is a scifi horror boardgame for 1 to 4 players with modular map tiles, cards, dice, amazing miniatures and a powerful narrative campaign. 
Players can manipulate time and space, jump between dimensions, and learn all kind of weird skills, while fighting or hidding from the twisted horrors that will infest their reality.

Players can perform common actions like moving, searching for items or attack enemies. But they can also hide from enemies, teleport though portals or jump to unknown areas of the map.
The attack system uses a combination of dice roll and card decks, including intense fight with huge bosses.

Rotating the modular map tiles, players change between dimensions, finding new secrets and special items but also unlocking deadly menaces.

The game has a timeline that controls the turns of players and creatures. The characters can use their skills to manipulate time, adjusting this timeline and the events of the campaign.

The core game has a 10 episodes campaign, with an average time of 90 to 120 minutes each one. The main goal of the game is to return to your own dimension, as players are lost in time and space.

All players and enemies are represented by highly detailed miniatures, including bosses and secondary characters.

—description from the publisher

Name: MeepFrog
Description:
MeepFrog is a fast, artisanal microgame of leaping Meeples on a pond, featuring all cloth and hardwood components.

It's a leapfrog match between red and blue! Use your side’s standing Meeples on the shore to jump over Meeples floating on the pond to score. Place yours in rows to score big, and place your opponents' in disadvantageous positions! Wild Meeples will block your path until returned to the bag, and Refresh Meeples will cause you to return any others to the bag. Score 5 Meeples of your color first to win!

—description from the designer

Name: Go-Kart Racing
Description:
Simple roll and move race game featuring single-fold game board, four plastic car pieces, a small d6 dice and shaker.

Game board has a figure of eight race track layout with 'fly-over' and short detour section.

—user summary

Name: And Time Passes
Description:
In this game for 1 to 2 players, you have to manage your time to be the most productive player without exhausting yourself. Both players share opposite sides of the same timeline causing your actions to affect the other player and vice versa. Each card has 4 productive activities and 4 resting activities; placing these cards beside, on top of, and underneath each other will allow you to bump up your productive score while keeping the other player as unproductive as possible. Will you master time management or will you exhaust yourself trying?

—description from the designer

Name: Cooper Island: Solo Against Cooper
Description: This deck of 24 cards lets you take on Cooper Island in solo mode by simulating the actions of the ultimate opponent: Cooper himself! It features several difficulty levels and lets you set different strategic priorities.

Name: Cooper Island: New boats
Description:
This promotional item for Cooper Island includes 4 new income boats and a landing stage. Each of these 4 boats has a different special income effect. During the game, they are displayed at the included landing stage in the general supply and each player can build one of them by performing the usual action.

—user summary

Name: I Spy: Mysterious Objects Card Game
Description: A matching game based on the "I Spy" series of seek-and-find picture books.  Players draw cards and attempt to match images on the drawn cards to those on the cards in their hand.  The first player to use up all of their cards by successfully matching objects is the winner.

Name: Bionicle: Quest for the Nest
Description: Bionicle: Quest for the Nest was a promotional board game released in select Toys "R" Us stores. The game was given to the first 75 contestants in an in-store contest as a consolation prize. The goal of the game is to answer "Bionicle" themed trivia questions in order to find the Bohrok nest. The winner is the first player to land on 'Finish'.

Name: ZhuZhu Pets: Zhu-oom to the Finish
Description: A game similar to Chutes & Ladders (AKA Snakes & Ladders) in which players implement a spinner to move around the board.  Each player takes charge of the hamster of their choice in in a race to the finish that encourages children to focus on colors and numbers.

Name: Xonko
Description:
A card game in which players earn points by using their cards to form words.  Players must form words with a minimum of three letters with the XONKO card acting as a wildcard.  The first to 500 points is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Ice Warriors
Description: This expansion adds Ice Warriors to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, three Ice Warrior faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Mire
Description: This expansion adds the Mire to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes one Odin and three Mire soldier miniatures, three Mire faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Gallifreyan Guard
Description: This expansion adds Gallifreyan Guards to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five Gallifreyan Guard faction cards, and five new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Tetraps
Description: This expansion adds Tetraps to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Tetraps faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Time Warrior
Description: This expansion adds two characters from the Time Warrior episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Sontaran Linx and a human Irongron miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Professor Yana & Chantho
Description: This expansion adds Professor Yana and Chantho to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Professor Yana/War Master miniature and a Chantho miniature, three faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Return of Doctor Mysterio
Description: This expansion adds characters from the episode The Return of Doctor Mysterio to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Doctor Sim miniature and a Ghost miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Clockwork Droids
Description: This expansion adds Clockwork Droids to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Clockwork Droids faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Time Lords
Description: This expansion adds Time Lords to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Time Lord faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Emojibots
Description: This expansion adds Emojibots to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, one Emojibot faction card, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Empress of Mars
Description: This expansion adds characters from the Empress of Mars episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes an Emoress of Mars miniature and a Friday miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

Name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Fighter
Description:
Ezrok the Fighter is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok is a mere soldier in the Army of the Protector. It is during this time that Ezrok establishes his reputation as a renowned warrior.

The modules include:


     Elves of the Underworld
     Terror of the Crag Gargoyles
     Wrath of the Squid Demon
     Strike of the Hill Giants
     Rescue from the Mushroom Ogres


—description from the designer

Name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Warlord
Description:
Ezrok the Warlord is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok leads a portion of the Army of the Protector. It is during this time that Ezrok advances his skills in warfare strategy.

The modules include:


     Bloodbath at Altar Hill
     Scourge of the Wolfmen Beasts
     Engagement with the Ice Elves
     Adventure in the Mouth of Hell
     Rise of the Last Sorcerer


—description from the designer

Name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Border Marshal
Description:
Ezrok the Border Marshal is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok accepts the post of border marshal. It is during this time that Ezrok is entrusted with safeguarding the outer borders of the heartland.

The modules include:


     Madness of the Minotaur Cult
     Dawn of the Black Dragons
     Marauders of the Wasteland
     Trouble on Troll Mountain
     Evil in a Dead Forest


—description from the designer

Name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok the Protector
Description:
Ezrok the Protector is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in the era where Ezrok has become king of Calatar. It is during this time that Ezrok must resolve internal conflicts within the heartland; along with indulging a series of dangerous hunting expeditions.

The modules include:


     Conflict in Ardon
     Conspiracy of Blood
     Hunt for the Wild Griffin
     Storm of the Grey Mastodons
     The Giant Boar of Valadur


—description from the designer

Name: Ezrok Wargame System: Ezrok – The Lost Adventures
Description:
Ezrok — The Lost Adventures is a free print & play module set that uses the Ezrok Wargame System (EWS). The EWS framework is a minimalistic hex & counter wargame system designed for quick play. This set consists of five modules; each having its own map, counters and other materials. The modules in this set take place in various periods of Ezrok’s life, and are considered to be his lesser known exploits.

The modules include:


     Invasion of the Amazons
     Assault of the Arctic Beastmen
     Fury of the Lizard Men
     War of the Damned
     Lair of the Muck Monsters


—description from the designer

Name: Gearworks: Yakyong Promo Card
Description:
A promo tinkerer card that can be used in place of the other red tinkerer (Bartleby).

Ability: "When replacing a gear card, take the card you replaced to hand."

Name: Minute Diktator
Description:
A low luck 2-player area majority game.  Player play 4 cards from a hand of 8, with each card adding influence to one area and removing (1 less) influence from another area.  Then players pick up all 8 cards and swap hands in preparation for the second round.  There is also a secret bid between rounds on which areas you think you will have won by the end of the game.  Winning majorities and making your bid score you points.

From the Game Box:
You and your rival are each rallying your numerous supporters to be the next and most inspirational commander.  However, you must convince the shadowy Council of Five to back you.  The Council collectively wield enough power to determine which of you will triumph and which will be ... forgotten.  To sway the Council members to back your claim, you and your opponent will each champion a unique series of policies.  Each policy will earn approval from one of the Council members, but simultaneously harm your standing with another.  Angering any one member too much can result in dire consequences.  To gain an additional edge, form secret alliances with Council members and dramatically reveal your plots to devastating effect.  A poorly timed decision and cost you everything, but the right ones will see you claim the mantle of Diktator.

Name: Manicure Hero
Description:
All's fair in love and nails...

Have you ever wanted to dip a well painted toe into the seedy underbelly of the nail salon business?

In Manicure Hero, you and up to 5 friends take on the role of nail stylists competing for the most tips!  Beware rip-off artists and your fellow stylists.
 In this light card, players take turns planning v cards from their hand face down into rows which represent different nail salons that the players are freelancing at.  Cards that they can place include tip cards, action cards, rip-off cards, and their unique character card.  One all cards are laid down, cards are turned face up and scored.  The more tip cards in your character's row the higher your score.  If two or more players share a row, tips are divided evenly.  The player with the most tops after three rounds in the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: The Mount of the Duke (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
In the area next to the walled city of Carcassonne there is an amazing forest. Recently there are plenty of thieves, bandits and all sorts of people in this forest. It is believed that Robin Hood is around, and his friends are now in control of the forest. 
Will you win more points in this new adventure or will you lose all hope when you reach the burned inn?

—Jose Barros Alonso

Name: The Island of Dr. Culebra
Description:
THE STORY
On an island far from humanity lies a secret facility run by a mad scientist. She is the most evil person—the most cunning, the most horrific (and did I mention evil?) person known to woman. Her facility consists of a laboratory, a torture chamber, holding cells, and a labyrinth.

The laboratory is where the doctor performs her illicit experiments. She has kidnapped people around the world to be her test subjects. She not only has figured out how to clone her subjects but has figured out how to crossbreed animals with humans and vice-versa. One of her successful experiments was of a human and a rat. These hideous creatures are known as BREEDERS. They are half the size of an average human. They are fast, hard to detect, and only come out at night to feed on unexpected prey.

The loud sounds you hear could only be the screams and moans of agony coming from the torture chamber. The torture chamber is where the doctor analyses each subject's tolerance to pain and suffering. She will push their limits until they break or die. Out of the hundreds of corpses that did not pass the test, only six have made it thus far.

These six subjects are known as REAPERS. They are creatures that take on the form of a human and an animal that have been genetically modified and mutated. They are in their holding cells where they await to be released into the labyrinth and unleash their terrifying acts of evil. They are trained to prey on human flesh and they will stop at nothing until they do.

While these are some of the ghastly things to come out of the doctor's laboratory, it does not end there. Some of her experiments consist of chemical solutions that alter one's abilities. Thus, giving them supernatural powers. This supernatural ability can range from running five times faster than a cheetah to being undetectable like a Chameleon. This chemical solution is called GEN-13. GEN-13 derives from 12 separate chemical solutions plus one unknown. When the unknown is used on a creature, it becomes the ELEMENTAL. The ELEMENTAL has the power to claim all 12 chemical solutions if present.

The doctor is now looking to abduct new test subjects around the world to continue with her GEN-13 experiments. This evil doctor is known as Dr. Culebra.

OVERVIEW
In The Island of Dr. Culebra, you play the role of one of Dr. Culebra's test subjects. You and the other test subjects will need to plan, strategize and work together to escape the labyrinth. You and others will be injected with a serum that has a chemical solution that alters your abilities. You and others will use your new ability to overcome obstacles, traps, and creatures in hope of finding a way out of the labyrinth. Will you and others be able to meet the challenge and escape the Island of Dr. Culebra?

OBJECTIVE
The object of the game is to escape from the labyrinth of Dr. Culebra's Island. The labyrinth consists of obstacles, traps, and creatures. You will need to find the exit before the time runs out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alien Evasion
Description:
THE STORY
In a galaxy far, far away, lies a planet that are occupied by different but cute little aliens. This planet is so incredible that they all left their planet to come here for their yearly vacation. But little did they know, the planet is doomed for destruction and approaching a supernova.

OBJECTIVE
Collect your aliens and rearrange them in a away that makes it efficient and sufficient to launch your rockets. Escape with as many available rockets as possible to gain Victory Points. Be the first one to gain the most Victory Points to win the game.

Will you be able to meet the challenge and help these aliens return to their home planet and be known as the biggest hero in the galaxy?

—description from the publisher

Name: Polemos: Ruse de Guerre
Description:
A set of tabletop miniatures wargame rules covering the wars in the United States and Canada in the latter half of C18 and the early C19: the French & Indian Wars, the American Revolution/American War of Independence and the War of 1812. 
Sharing some features with the other rules using the Polemos system, the rules aim to focus on the decisions made by army commanders whilst using quite simple processes to deal with the details of movement, combat and morale, hopefully producing plausible outcomes without the need to do slow or complicated calculations.  The heart of the system is about bidding for and using Tempo Points: commanders must trade off speed of action against the ability to have greater control over all units.
The game includes a number of scenarios from the three covered conflicts to give players a good idea of how big the various armies are and how they are organized.  It uses a variable scale, so smaller and bigger armies, battles and tables can all be accomodated.

Name: Dino Crash 3D
Description:
Let the children turn into huge dinosaurs for a while. All they need is special figures and a beautifully illustrated plan of Dino Crash. Players must escape with their character as soon as possible and in the shortest way to safety from the roaring volcano. In addition to speed, it is necessary to involve caution, along the route lurking treacherous Tyrannosaurus Rex!
While children run away from the pitfalls of prehistoric times, they will practice playfully combining and tactical skills. The set was made in the Czech Republic.

Name: Rallyman: GT – World Tour
Description:
Hit the road and challenge your opponents on new tracks inspired by famous circuits from around the world!

The World Tour expansion brings 12 new tiles to use in creating 10 new tracks or giving you even more options when creating your own!

Name: Arbiträre Regeln
Description:
Arbitrary Rules is a card driven meta-party game which runs passively in the background. The idea of the game is to bring people together in a humorous way. It helps connecting strangers and can function as a social catalyst, be an icebreaker for flirting attempts and makes the players to be attentive about the situations happening around them.

Each player receives an equal amount of cards (depending on how many players will take part) which describes specific but arbitrary rules. After that the game begins.

If a player notices that someone violates one of the rules described on his cards, he plays the card and the player who violated the rule will be sanctioned. After that he passes the card and swaps it with a card of the sanctioned player.

The game has no fixed ending, it ends arbitrarily!

The player who plays the most cards during the game will win. To count the amount of cards which each player plays, tokens such as coins or bottle caps are used.

Name: Warrior of the Wastes
Description:
It is all about Conquest – conquest of the treacherous Wastes! The Wastes are a realm of mystery, magic and most definitely death. You WILL become the Warlord who takes your lowly Clan and raises it to the realm of Empire, if you can only advance through the challenges, quests and battles that lay ahead. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing hierarchies, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page.  You roll. You write.  Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask.  This takes the 1 Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) further into the Fantasy Realm.

—description from the designer

Name: Toraja
Description:
Toraja, South Sulawesi. A region in Indonesia that famous for its coffee. Many Coffee Expert are considering Torajan Coffee as one of the best speciality coffee in the world. In this game, You are land owner in Toraja that dreams of changing it into a coffee plantation. You do that by managing your resources and carefully plans your landscape. Establishing Trade with other region will also give you competitive advantage. The most effective player wins the game!

Toraja is played in two phases: Drafting and Building. In the drafting phase, you draft resource cards and making combo out of it. Collected resources can then be used to build or improve your coffee plantation, and possibly gain benefit from initiating foreign trade. Clever plays wins the game.

Name: Three Kingdoms: Expansion
Description: This Expansion is MoDian(Chinese App like Kickstarter) Stretch goal reward. Add 5 more Historical scenarios, 2 more Competition scenarios, and Generals 1 VS 1 optional rule. This Expansion also bring 3 sheets of counters.

Name: Top or Drop
Description:
Play either the highest or the lowest cards and at the same time match colors. If you are the first to get rid of all your cards you win the game. With special cards and personal strategy you can increase your chances to win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms – Ver. Lord Expansion
Description: This Expansion is MoDian (Chinese App like Kickstarter) Stretch goal reward. Add 5 more lords, famous treasures and Generals from Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

Name: Delve & Despair
Description:
OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
The game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The objective of the game is to survive the dungeons while you search and try to vanquish the Dark Lord that rules them.

STORY
The players take on the role of HEROES that are resting in an old tavern. While enjoying the music and drinking the ale, they listen stories about some ancient ruins on the outskirts of the town. A sinister place that is the entrance to a gloomy dungeon. It is said that one can find great treasures among the shadows of the dark rooms under those ruins, but even greater dangers. There have been countless occasions in which curious townsfolk or brave adventurers fall victim to this terrible place.

The HEROES decide to enter the ruins and descend through the forgotten corridors until they reach the entrance of the dungeon.

With determination they will choose their path, some of them for glory, others for treasure, all of them for adventure.

THE GAME
The players have 12 different HEROES to choose from: Alchemist, Barbarian, Bard, Hunter, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warrior, Illusionist, Rogue, Mage and Monk.

The game is divided into Rooms and the Rooms into Encounters. At the same time, some Encounters like combat are divided into turns.

Each HERO has 5 Talents. The HERO Special Talent has a specific ability (only available to that specific hero) on one side and a set of Talents that specific HERO can choose on the other. Each player will be able to choose from a pool of 30 different Talents in order to build their HERO.
 There are different types of rooms in the game. When revealing a new room the Encounters in it must be prepared and confronted. Encounters must be resolve in a specific sequence.
 Events must always be resolved first, since some of them can modify the other Encounters found in the room, then are the Enemies which are the most common Encounters and last but not least the Chest/Corpse. Only this last two Encounters are indifferent in which one is resolve first as well as optional to advance to the next room.

While adventuring HEROES will eventually get hurt. There are 2 ways in which a HERO can receive damage in this game.
 There is fatigue which translates into Stress tokens and then there’s physical damage which translates into Damage tokens.

Players will need to learn how to work as a team, manage their resources and combo their talents...

Are you ready to Delve & Despair?

—description from the designer

Name: Polonka 1660
Description:
The Battle of Polonka (PoÅ‚onka) took place near PoÅ‚onka (modern Belarus) during the Polish-Russian War (1658-1667) on 29 June 1660 between Polish-Lithuanian forced, led by PaweÅ‚ Jan Sapieha and Stefan Czarnecki and Russian army, led by Ivan Khovansky. Thanks to the well made battle plan, tactical advantage and much more experienced and skilled troops, battle was a big victory of Polish-Lithuanian units, despite the fact that both sides have almost the same number of solders.

Game uses "Husaria" system and covers all three stages of the battle, including initial skirmishes and full battle.

Name: Cine Write and Trade
Description:
You are a group of film screenwriters working in the era of the increasingly large film industry. In the next year, your job is to be the most productive screenwriter like the producer wants. At the end of every quarter of the year, you will face a producer to earn your income. However, writing is not an easy job, so you have to help each other and deal to find the right words of inspiration. Earning a lot of money may not necessarily be the road to your success because at the end of the year it's the most important reputation in the industry that determines your victory.

In Cine Write and Trade, players will: Write words... Sell words... Buy words... and Guess Words...

In the process, players will write words then sell it to another player, so every player will buy and sell words from each others. This process will build deductions and create sense of progression so finally every player can guess another players secret words. Player with most reputation point will be the winner of the game.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Counter Surge
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Counter Surge deck focuses on green and black energies.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Vehicle Rush
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Vehicle Rush deck includes  white, black, and red energies. It focuses on vehicles, making it slightly more complex to play than the other Challenger Decks in the 2020 series

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Hazoret Aggro
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Hazoret Aggro deck includes red energy, and it is the only Challenger Deck of the 2020 series to include only one color. In the tradition of Aggro Decks, this deck focuses of inflicting damage quickly and efficiently, before the opponent has the time to unfold a long-term strategy.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Second Sun Control
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Second Sun Control deck includes white and blue energies. In the tradition of Control decks, it focuses on negating the main maneuvers of the opponent in order to win the game in the long run.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Lightning Aggro
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Lightning Aggro deck includes only red energy. In the tradition of Aggro deck, it focuses on inflicting damage early on during the game.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Deadly Discovery
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
This deck focuses on green and black energy. Its mix of creatures and straightforward effects makes it particularly friendly to beginners.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Arcane Tempo
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
This deck includes red and blue energies. In the tradition of Tempo decks, it focuses on disrupting the tempo of the opponent, forcing them to use their mana inefficiently.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: United Assault
Description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The United Assault deck includes only white energy. It was designed as a cohesive deck that could resist the pressures of the metagame. A reliable deck, that even a beginner could use with confidence.

Name: Splendor: Dice Con 2019 Promo cards – Zhang Qian and Xiang Fei
Description:
Two new nobles tiles to be used for Splendor.

Artwork included one male and female noble---Chinese official and diplomat Zhang Qian (å¼ éªž) and the Fragrant Concubine Xiang Fei (é¦™å¦ƒ).

The bottom right hand corner of each tile is marked with a “p” to indicate that it is a promotional noble.

Exclusive promo for Dice Con 2019 event.

Name: Sorrow! Death of a King
Description: In Sorrow! Death of a King, the King has died and all the Kings men struggle to empty out the Royal Treasury first and to become the new ruler of this medieval Kingdom. You play cards to represent your court supporters and Archer mercenaries as you struggle against your opponents to rule the court and gain the most money by whatever means from the dead King's treasury and to purchase the support needed to become the next ruler of the land.

Name: Monolith: Board Game System
Description:
Monolith is the core or basal element of a new entertainment system reported in the form of the board game or the Monolith system.
The system sees Monolith as the central element which is the base box comparable to the classic concept of Console.
The central element of the "Monolith" system is interpreted as a console

Inside the box there are in fact the cardid elements, such as the player's dashboard (pad), dice, cubes, dividing screens, etc., which will be inserted with the components present in the boxes that the player decides to purchase. So as to give shape to the game you chose to play with, generating a completely new and engaging game experience
A Monolith box allows you to support a minimum of 2 players up to a maximum of 6, depending of course on the game you want to play with.
The games currently available for this platform are: Browl Inn, Atomic World, Terror

Browl Inn: competitive fight simulator for 2 to 6 players with an average duration of 30 ’per game
Atomic World: cooperative game for 3 to 4 players with an average duration of 60 ’per game
Terror: semi-competitive management from 2 to 5 players with an average duration of 45 ’per game

Name: Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology
Description:
Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology is, as the name suggests, an anthology of roll-and-write games in book form, specifically ten different games from eleven designers for a range of player counts and complexity levels. The games range from charting the stars and regaling one another with the mythology that surrounds the constellations, to building and protecting coral reefs, to portraying nature taking over an abandoned city.

To play the games, you need to provide your own writing implements and dice, specifically a half-dozen six-sided dice in one color, another half-dozen six-sided dice in another color, a six-sided die in a third color, and a four-sided, eight-sided, and ten-sided die.

Name: いろかるた (Color Karuta)
Description:
ã„ã‚ã‹ã‚‹ãŸ (Color Karuta) is a color-building game in which players take transparent cards in five colors (CMYK and white) and overlay them in an attempt to recreate a color presented to them by an opponent or a color on an object in real life. The order in which you stack the cards matters, so build with care!

The game includes Ukiyo-e postcards that can serve as targets to match in color should you not have anything else appropriate within reach.
user summary

This is a game to create colors by combining transparent color cards.
é€ã‘ã‚‹è‰²ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’çµ„ã¿åˆã‚ã›ã¦è‰²ã‚’ã¤ãã£ã¦éŠã¶ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ 
publisher's summary

Name: CarlSpies: Big City Living – Expansion Pack
Description:
Owning CarlSpies Deluxe will make your family above average. However, adding The Big City Living Expansion Pack (a 30 card add-on to the full game) will increase your family's above averageness by 10x !!  The expansion pack includes cards for things like Toll Booths, Street Musicians, Graffiti, and other stuff you might see around large metropolitan cities (seems obvious?!)

—description from the publisher

Name: Madeira Collector's Edition
Description:
This game was crowdfunded but was not delivered to backers.

Madeira, the classic strategy game, was intended to return in a KickStarter exclusive Collector’s Edition Big Box including 4 new modular expansions, the Ambassadors and Harvester expansions, and new premium components.

Name: Sierra West: Goat-Kart Trail Blazing Promo
Description:
Components:

     4 player board overlay cards (1 per player)
     1 setup/rules card
     1 goat meeple


Whenever you may gain the mule, you may gain the goat instead. The having the goat extends the range of your wagon by one additional row card under the wagon trail.

This was given out as a promo at Essen Spiel 2019.

Name: Sport Billy
Description:
Based on the famous cartoon hero Sport Billy, this is a simple roll the dice and move vintage board game. It was made in Greece from Stam Toys toy company, probably in the early 80's.

It can be played from 2-4 players. The winner is the first player who reaches endpoint by the exact number. There are some spaces on the board, with different symbols upon them. When you reach a space with a symbol of a dice you can play again. The blue circle symbol means that you have to go 6 spaces backwards, the yellow circle means that you lose your turn. Moreover, when you reach a space with a blue star upon it, you move 4 spaces forward and you can play one more time. When you reach a space with a red star upon it, you must go back in the beginning.

—user summary

Name: Long, Cruel Woman: The Attack on Firebase Mary Ann, March 28, 1971
Description:
“The war didn’t make sense anymore. We all thought it was bullshit. We weren’t solving anything, we weren’t helping to win the war. We were just there, and it basically came down to staying alive and keeping your buddies alive.” –Pfc. Edward W. Voros, Company A, 46th Infantry, Americal Division, March 1971.

For most Americans, by the Spring of 1971, the “light at the end of tunnel” that had become the War in Vietnam was in sight. Peace talks were well underway in Paris, as was “Vietnamization’; President Nixon’s official policy for turning over the bulk of the war effort and fighting to the forces of the ARVN (Army of the Republic of [South] Vietnam). As part of the transition the 23rd US Infantry Division, the “Americal”, was due to be rotated out of fighting and turning over its positions to ARVN’s First Corp. The Americal had earned a bad reputation two years earlier at My Lai, and the division was subjected to a complete review and re-organization following that atrocity. The higher-ups decreed there would be no more “screw ups” by this unit while it served out its remaining time “in country.”

One of the most remote American positions was Fire Base Mary Ann, not far from Chu Lai, occupied by elements of the 46th Regiment of the Americal Division. By the last week of March an ARVN artillery battery had already moved in and the base was to be completely turned-over in early April. However, the local Viet Cong (Communist South Vietnamese) commander saw a growing opportunity during the transition to strike a final blow against the Imperialist forces of the US. Deploying the elite 409th Sapper Battalion for the attack, the Communist’s “parting shot” was to remind both the US and ARVN that the war was far from over.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Standard Deck Activation System (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Detective: A Modern Crime Board Game – Stand-Alone Case: Natural Causes
Description:
Professor Calvin Higgs is found dead in his lab at the Biology Institute of Virginia University. Can you find out why he died? Who is responsible? Your detective skills, teamwork spirit, and imagination are needed to solve the crime.

“Natural Causes” is a short case with a playtime of around 90 minutes. It provides a perfect opportunity for those who would like to try out the game for the first time as well as those who already played the base game and are looking for a case to introduce new players to the game and invite friends to the hobby.

Note: The original Print and Play of this case was stand alone, the physical printing requires the base game.
Families: Game: Detective – A Modern Crime Board Game (Portal Games)

Name: Metro: International Fair Promo Tile
Description: The "international fair" tile is to be inserted in the draw pile. It represent the cities where lies the main European trade shows. It has the 4 colors of the métro lines.

Name: Blue Ribbon Pie
Description:
You and your fellow compatriots are all on your way to becoming famous pie making Cheflebrities! You have all been selected for a contest competing with each other in the kitchen to build the best quality pies as you possibly can!

Blue Ribbon Pie is a fun, casual, family card game! You take turns drawing cards from the ingredients pile, playing a card on your turn, and putting together the best quality pies you can! But watch out, mistakes can be made and people can sabotage each other in the kitchen with special cards. Points are tallied up at the end based on quality and special conditions to find out who the winner is!

—description from the designer

Name: Eternal: Chronicles of the Throne – Gold and Steel
Description:
The Battle for the Eternal Throne continues!
The Rebellion has failed; the devastated city of Argenport rebuilds into a blossoming center of trade and commerce that attracts merchants from across Myria. Deadly weapons, powerful allies, and priceless treasures can be yours... if you have the coin to spend.

The first expansion for Eternal: Chronicles of the Throne introduces exciting new strategies to your deck-building, card-battling experience. Amass gold to purchase cards from your own secret market and unleash cunning surprises on your opponents. Equip your units with new weapons to increase their strength and expand their abilities.

The markets are open in Gold and Steel – to the victor go the spoils!

Name: Element Poker
Description: Element Poker combines 52 elements from the periodic table with Texas Hold 'em.  It's your chance to learn the properties of elements and their relationships while playing poker!

Name: Angel Investor
Description:
Angel Investor is a deck-building game for 2 to 4 players. Players are investors competing to become the most famous before they run out of money. The game is presented as a satire on silicon-valley start-up culture with card art that depicts anthropomorphic animals taking part in exaggerated acts of office politics.

It features unique deck-building mechanics where all players modify cards in every "start-up" deck. It was designed by an artificial intelligence consulting company using their algorithms to optimize balance through simulation and boasts a simultaneously chaotic and high skill game as a result.

—description from the designer

Name: Dinosaur Island: Space Dinosaur Promo
Description:
This Promo item is a fun Godspeed themed add-on compatible with our hit game Dinosaur Island - not for use in Godspeed.

Includes:
1 Space Raptor Dinosaur Tile
1 Set of 4 Space Raptor Meeples (first printing are pink, second printing are black)
1 Astronaut Specialist Card

Name: Village Pillage: Surf
Description:
It’s stressful, running a village. The raiders bully the farmers, the farmers dirty up the walls, and the walls always get in everyone’s way! Time to take a holiday to the sea. The sea is powerful, and beautiful, like a turnip. And wet and smelly, also like a turnip.

And, like a turnip, the sea is crawling with pests today - those horrible other villages have had the same idea as you!

Well that’s just fine. There are plenty of salty seadogs hanging around, looking for adventure. They’re not the most reliable, true, but they’re just so salty! Time to rally up a crew, get abaft the binnacle, and chart a course for VICTORY!

Surf introduces a new type of card to Village Pillage - Freebooters, who sail into your hand faster than ever before. Whenever you buy a card, you can spend an additional turnip to recruit a Freebooter. But be warned - they’ll abandon ship at the first sign of trouble.

Additionally, Surf features a new extended-play bank card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Village Pillage: Turf
Description:
You’re proud of your villagers. Your farmer is as strong as an ox. Your merchant is as cunning as a fox. Your raider floats like a butterfly, and stings like a bee! Why, the only things more hard-working, cunning and stingy would be…

Actual animals! Brilliant! Your merchants will recruit creatures great and small, and put them to work animalling your village’s libraries, archery ranges, and china shops. You’ll be the envy of those other villages with all their silly HUMAN workers. Two legs good, four legs better!

Turf brings a whole new set of villagers to the market (along with their animal pals), features cards that can affect the entire table (at any player count!), and introduces a brand new mechanism - Provoke! Provoke is the opposite of Exhaust - if your card is Provoked, you must play it next turn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Potted Plant Promo Card
Description:
This is a promo card for the Munchkin Collectible Card Game

Card #305
Rarity: F - FOMO
Type: Neutral - Location

This comes into play zapped.

All Monsters with a gold cost of 1 gain 1 life.

Monstrous 1 (When this is committed to a fight, it is a 1 gold, 1 power, 1 life Monster card. Its card type changes to "Monster" and it has no other ability.)

Name: Dark Woods of Winter: A New Campaign for Five Leagues From the Borderlands
Description:
Are you ready for your solo / same-side fantasy campaigns to take the next steps?

After adventuring in the borderlands, gather your sword and torches and venture deep into The Woods seeking fortune and glory.

Dark Woods of Winter is a campaign supplement for Five Leagues From the Borderlands, exploring the deep, dark fey-haunted woodlands of the fantasy world.

Encounter outlaws, vengeful elfin spirits and the horrors of the deep, dark.

This expansion offers the following:


    Brand new encounters, creatures and enemies with more detail than ever.



    New loot to acquire and new skills to earn.



    A new category of encounters: Special Encounters with everything from evil spirits to temporary NPC allies. 


You can even get your own wolf cub!


    A greater challenge, with more risks (and rewards) than the core rules adventure tables.



    More bleak, foggy heavy metal feel than you can shake an over-sized sword at.



     * * * *


Dark Woods of Winter is a 32 page campaign replacement, offering a new way to play the game.

It does not replace the original game rules and they are needed to use this supplement.

YOU MUST OWN A COPY OF "FIVE LEAGUES FROM THE BORDERLANDS" TO USE THIS PRODUCT.

This supplement increases the supernatural presence a fair bit. If you prefer a more naturalistic game, it may not fit your intentions.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: The Goblin Hills: A New Campaign for Five Leagues From the Borderlands
Description:
On the road down to the village, you admired the scenery: Majestic mountains and wind- blasted crags overlooking a fierce, rugged wilderness with tiny specks of civilization scattered throughout.

Arriving in town, you noticed the tense, fearful looks in the eyes of the locals. Militia men, too old or too young, clutch their spears while patrolling the palisades.

As you ask around, the villagers whisper one word in response:

“Goblin”


     * * * *


In this brand new campaign for the Five Leagues solo battle game, you are tasked with defending a village from raids of blood-drunk goblins.

As you turn the tide of battle, you must track down their lair and venture into the dark to crush the rotten heart.

Facing barbed arrows, goblin-venom and sorceries, you will have allies fighting on your side to even the odds, offering a chance for large skirmishes with a dozen or so combatants on each side.

As you progress, you will acquire new treasures as rewards, including vile goblin weapons, and learn unique skills obtainable only through this campaign.

As always, we include options to tailor the game, including 6 variant goblin types and "players choice" options for customization.


     * * * *


This product requires a copy of the Five Leagues rules to use.

It is intended for a war band with some experience under its wings and can be played as part of any long-running campaign along with the core rules experience and Dark Woods of Winter.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: The Descendants of Volos
Description:
Update: Because of file size limits for uploading files, here is link to the newly published game tutorial in PDF. Available both in English and Polish: http://spinningdice.pl/game-tutorial/

The Descendants of Volos is a competitive roleplaying adventure board game set in a fantasy realm inspired by Slavic mythology. Players will play the role of one of many characters called Velevits or "The Descendants of Volos". They are born with mysterious abilities. Their common special ability is the presence of 3 souls (lives).

The main goal of the game is to become the most powerful and authoritative character within a limited amount of time. You can do it by gaining victory points throughout collecting the achievements and influence tokens (those you get by completing randomly generated quest sequences and solving cases for your organization). There is no "best way" of winning this game. You'll have to improvise, adapt and overcome! This is a competitive game, so not only you should collect victory points, but also try interrupting the other players.

When traveling around the peninsula, your character will fight various monsters, face various situations, grow in strength, collect unique gear, fulfill the quests, and become an influential and respected member of their organizations.

The game is focused on adventures, PvP (Player vs Player) and plenty of PvE (Player vs Enemy) combats. Large and modular map gives incredible replay value. 800+ adventure cards stuffed with unique elements like trinkets, weapons, armors, enemies, side quests and situations. The character evolution is full of choices. Spending skill points on any attribute like strength, agility, intellect, or vitality will shape your combat abilities.

The game can be played by 1 to 4 players and the number of players only slightly affects the playing time, as unique game rules allow half of actions in each turn to be performed simultaneously. It means that you're playing almost all the time, and the waiting time per turn is minimal. There are also special mechanics designed for players who end the game prematurely, so even though they lose, they can still play by becoming a "minion master." The powerful monsters that were quietly sitting in the dungeons, have been now unleashed and are crawling out and chasing the remaining players. The intensity of the gameplay grows, and the player that lost prematurely can now take revenge, or simply troll the remaining players. This and much much more unique solutions will be revealed before the kickstarter campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Agents of Mayhem: Gremlin Tech Deck 1
Description:
Dice Tower KS Promo 2019.

A pack of seven Gremlin Tech Cards for Agents of Mayhem!

Name: Subatomic: Stephen Hawking Promo Cards
Description:
Dice Tower KS Promo 2019.

A set of 3 Stephen Hawking cards for Subatomic.

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Zombie Cosplayer Promo Card
Description:
Dice Tower KS 2019.

Exclusive Zombie Cosplayer Follower Card.

Text says:
On any turn where you resolve 1 or more gun results, roll a die, on a zombie result, discard this follower.

Name: Sweet Piety!
Description: In Sweet Pietyyy, players are residents of a small village and are trying to prevent "vamPIEre" from eating their desserts. Each player will have a different eating pattern according to their identity, and the goal of the game is to hold pie parties around the clock to deduct which team each player belongs to. If his eating times line up in a cross on the clock, then he might be a vamPIEre! A light and innovative social deduction game for 4-8 players that can be played within 20 minutes.

Name: The Portable Wargame
Description:
A set of simple miniatures wargame rules designed to be played quickly on a small board with a square or hex grid and using only a small number of figures.  There are specific rules for two periods within the book: a nineteenth century 'Colonial' warfare set and a set for the first half of the twentieth century.
The book contains some mechanisms for playing the game solitaire and some designers' notes.

Name: Zuid Afrika: Those Restless Years – The Anglo Boer Confrontation 1883-1900
Description:
In the middle of the 19th century, the Boers had won the first Anglo-Boer war and managed to rescue themselves from the English rule, but their newborn Republics were unstable both politically and economically. Furthermore, there, remained a situation of great hostility against Great Britain. When immense diamond veins were discovered in Transvaal, the following decades (1860-1890) opened the way for a new economical and armed conflict.

"Zuid Afrika: Those Restless Years - The Anglo Boer Confrontation 1883-1900" is a card-driven wargame for 1-4 players that traces the path that led South Africa to the Second Anglo-Boer War (the most dramatic one), which ended in 1902, after a long, fatiguing guerrilla warfare.

In Zuid Afrika (ZA), up to four players seek to influence the fate of South Africa. They are:

     the British (government of the Cape colony).
     the Natives, Bantu and older populations.
     the Boers heirs of the Dutch colonizers.
     the Uitlanders (literally foreigners) often technical and / or mining personnel, also discriminated like black labor men.


Each faction uses its forces or abilities to influence areas on the map, has its own victory goal, different from the others. The British seek military victory in addition to neutralizing anti-racist demonstrations. The Natives try to turn mining workers into guerrilla warfare and try to establish communities in territories. The Boers try to enlarge their resources and exchange them with weapons. The Uitlanders promote a cultural struggle against apartheid  and act, above all, in the cities, seeking the favor of the population.

—description from the designer

Name: Barbarian Mints
Description:
You play as a lone barbarian in a land of trees, sand, and mountains.  You are on a mission to reclaim your throne from a conniving usurper, but you must travel through the unforgiving lands of danger and peril.  Use and carefully upgrade your skills as you travel.  By the time this month passes, when the moon has gone through its phases, it will be too late.

Players hold all the cards needed to play in their hand.  Taking into account the player's skill value in addition to the values on the cards, each event on the cards will have a level of difficulty.  Beat that difficulty, and the player succeeds!  Fail and the repercussions could be loss of health, water, gold or be forced to retreat.  Hex by hex, the player makes their way back to the city where the throne awaits!

Deeply inspired by the 1981 game Barbarian Prince, I've made this game in an attempt to capture the fun and excitement of exploration, adventure, and wilderness-living; while avoiding a dense book of tables and the somewhat arbitrary nature of the classic 1981 game.  All the wonder of exploration, condensed into a mint tin, with only cards, paperclips, and the player's sense of adventure!

—description from the publisher

Name: Brainbox: People at Work
Description: BrainBox People at Work has 53 cards with interesting facts on people at work and the jobs they do. Each round takes 10 seconds so all players are involved. A game lasts as long as you want it to, 10 minutes is the norm, but playing for 5 minutes is also great fun. BrainBox is educational and is perfect for families and groups of friends to play, wherever they are, on a level-playing field. The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a dice. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: Brainbox: Science
Description:
Science is cool, and this brilliant BrainBox Science covers important topics taught to children aged seven to eleven, from life cycles to light, healthy plants to the human body, magnets to materials. This game has been developed by an experienced primary school science teacher, is suitable for all ability levels and is great fun!

Brainbox is an innovative Memory Recall game. It consists of picture cards, with questions on the reverse. Players are given 10 seconds to look at the picture, and then try and answer questions on the reverse of the card.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Brainbox Science is ideally suited to kids aged 8 and up. It makes a fantastic family game, and can be easily taken on evenings out, or family holidays!
